question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the code you generate is executable and can be demonstrated. Please create a transition effect editor that allows users to add various transition effects to different clips in a video, such as fade-in/fade-out, slide, dissolve, etc. Users should be able to preview each transition effect, adjust its duration, and ultimately generate a video with the transition effects.

checklist.title: Is the transition effect editor interface fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code creates a comprehensive UI with elements for video upload, clip management, transition selection, timeline visualization, and preview functionality. Score 0 if the core interface elements are missing, 5 if basic elements are present but not fully functional, and 10 if the interface includes drag-and-drop capabilities, clear visual indicators for transitions, and intuitive controls for adjusting transition parameters.

checklist.title: Are the core transition effects properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code implements at least the following transitions with proper parameterization: fade-in/fade-out, dissolve, wipe (multiple directions), slide (multiple directions), zoom, and rotation. Each effect should have customizable duration and easing functions. Deduct 2 points for each missing core transition effect. Give full points only if the transitions are implemented with proper rendering techniques (e.g., using WebGL for hardware acceleration when appropriate).

checklist.title: Is the video preview functionality working correctly?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether users can preview the entire video with transitions or individual transitions in isolation. The preview should accurately represent how the final video will look. Check if the preview supports: play/pause, seeking to specific points, real-time application of transition changes, and correct timing. Deduct 3 points if preview performance is noticeably slow, 5 points if transitions don't render accurately in preview, and 2 points if seeking/timeline navigation is not implemented.

checklist.title: Is the final video generation functionality implemented?
checklist.description: Assess if the code includes functionality to render and export the final video with all applied transitions. This should include proper video encoding (like H.264), maintaining original video quality, progress indicators during rendering, and options for output format and quality. Deduct 5 points if rendering is client-side only without server option for heavy processing, 3 points if video quality is significantly degraded, and 5 points if there's no export functionality at all.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as incompatible video formats, large files, browser compatibility issues, memory constraints) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-assisted transition recommendations 2. Template-based transition presets 3. Keyframe animation editor for custom transitions). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar transitions (e.g., multiple fade implementations) 2. Function modules unrelated to video editing (e.g., unnecessary social sharing features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive UI animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating video processing/UI/state management layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast scrubbing, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
